MajorClaims.MC1: they have other critical obligations to take, in order to make our society function in an ordered way

Claims.C1: all people who are able to work should pay tax to the government
Claims.C2: citizens have other important responsibilities to fulfil apart from paying tax

Premises.P1: it is the most important source of government's revenue, which is mainly used to serve all citizens
Premises.P2: a large proportion of the tax is spent on national defence and in maintaining social stability
Premises.P3: every one can work and live in a peaceful environment
Premises.P4: The tax is also used to pay the salaries of workers working in public service sectors, such as teachers and police officers
Premises.P5: these workers do not produce profit directly
Premises.P6: what they do is for the well-being of the whole society
Premises.P7: there are impoverished or disabled people in every society, needing help and support from others
Premises.P8: the government can provide some fund to ease their difficulties
Premises.P9: such financial help is usually far from enough
Premises.P10: aids from more capable or wealthier citizens are particularly crucial, which are a great complement to government support
Premises.P11: Another responsibility all citizens should take is to maintain social stability together with the police force
Premises.P12: There are criminals in every society, and the number of policemen the government can hire is limited
Premises.P13: it is quite necessary for the local residents to take actions and ensure the safety of the communities, by doing things like reporting suspicious activities to the police department
